snippet: The amateur model in college sports is in serious trouble, with a federal district judge certifying a class-action suit against the N.C.A.A.
abstract: Editorial urges the National Collegiate Athletic Association to settle with current and former student athletes who sued the organization for licensing their names and images for use in game footage, photographs and video games; contends a settlement would mend the blatantly unfair collegiate-athletic system in a way that addresses the Title IX issue; notes that the NCAA seems intent on fighting the suit.
lead_paragraph: The amateur model in college sports is in serious trouble, with a federal district judge certifying a class-action suit against the N.C.A.A.
